io.hekate.rpc

Annotation Type RpcAggregate


  • @Documented
 @Target(value=METHOD)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface RpcAggregate
    Enables aggregation on RPC interface's methods.

    This annotation can be placed on a method of an @Rpc-enabled interface in order execute such RPC method on all of the RPC cluster nodes in parallel. Once execution is completed, all results are aggregated and returned as a single result.

    Such method must have one of the following return types:

    • List
    • Set
    • Map
    • Collection
    • CompletableFuture<List|Set|Collection|Map>

    Aggregation error handling policy can be specified in remoteErrors() attribute:

    • RpcAggregate.RemoteErrors.IGNORE - Ignore all remote errors and return whatever results were successfully aggregated or an empty result if RPC failed on all nodes.
    • RpcAggregate.RemoteErrors.WARN - Same as RpcAggregate.RemoteErrors.IGNORE but also logs a WARN message for each failure.
    • RpcAggregate.RemoteErrors.FAIL - In case of any error fail the whole aggregation with RpcAggregateException.

    For more details about the Remote Procedure Call API and its capabilities please see the documentation of the RpcService interface.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      RpcAggregate.RemoteErrors remoteErrors
      Remote errors handling policy (see description of RpcAggregate.RemoteErrors's values).

    • Element Detail

      • remoteErrors

        public abstract RpcAggregate.RemoteErrors remoteErrors
        Remote errors handling policy (see description of RpcAggregate.RemoteErrors's values).
        Returns:
        Remote errors handling policy.
        Default:
        io.hekate.rpc.RpcAggregate.RemoteErrors.FAIL
